Multivariable Calculus | When the divergence theorem doesn't apply.

\begin{array}{l}\n\iiint_{S} \vec{F} \cdot d \vec{S} \text { for any } \\\n\qquad \begin{array}{l}\n\text { surface } \\\n\ddot{\Phi} \vec{F}=\left\langle\frac{x}{r^{3}}, \frac{y}{r^{3}}, \frac{z}{r^{3}}\right\rangle\n\end{array}\n\end{array}[imath]\iiint_{S} \vec{F} \cdot d \vec{S} \text { for any } [/imath] [imath]\qquad \begin{array}{l}\n\text { surface } [/imath] [imath]\ddot{\Phi} \vec{F}=\left\langle\frac{x}{r^{3}}, \frac{y}{r^{3}}, \frac{z}{r^{3}}\right\rangle[/imath]
